alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 27 at 5:47PM MST until August 27 at 10:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Sawtooth burn scar in... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 1000 PM MST. * At 547 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Sawtooth Burn Scar. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Sawtooth Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Sawtooth Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Queen Valley and Gold Camp. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
